TimestampCounter
TimestampCounter

A utility for accurately counting time without additive error.

Functions
TimestampCounter
TimestampCounter(
const SampleRate &sampleRate,
uint64 startTime = 0
)
Parameters
sampleRate
const SampleRate&

The rate to count at.

startTime
uint64

The time to start counting from, as the number of nanoseconds since Unix Epoch.

const SampleRate &sampleRate,
uint64 time
)

Start counting again with the specificed Sample Rate and from the specified time.

Parameters

const SampleRate&

The rate to count at.

time
uint64

The time to start counting from, as the number of nanoseconds since Unix Epoch.

reset
void reset(
uint64 time
)

Start counting again from the specified time, keeping the same Sample Rate

Parameters
time
uint64

The time to start counting from, as the number of nanoseconds since Unix Epoch.

void advance(
size_t n
)

Advances the counter by n periods.

Parameters

size_t

The number of periods to advance the counter.

Advances the counter by one period.

reverse
void reverse(
size_t n
)

Reverse the counter by n periods.

Parameters
n
size_t

The number of periods to advance the counter.

reverse
void reverse()

Reverse the counter by one period.

time

Gets the current time of the counter.

The current time of the counter, as the number of nanoseconds since Unix Epoch.
